title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds eyeing £17m Real Betis left-back Riza Durmisi?
text:
Riza Durmisi of Denmark takes a free kick (Photo: Kaz Photography / Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC     
Liverpool are reportedly monitoring Real Betis left-back Riza Durmisi. 
The Danish international has a £17million release clause in his contract and Anfield scouts have checked on his progress, according to the Daily Mail. 
James Milner has filled in impressively at left-back for the Reds this season but isn't a natural in that position, while Alberto Moreno has struggled for form. 
Durmisi, 23, moved to Bets from Brondby last summer and played against Liverpool in a pre-season friendly two and a half years ago. Gerrard 'anxious' about Reds return 
Steven Gerrard have revealed his excitement about returning to Liverpool as a youth coach. 
But the Kop legend has admitted that he remains "nervous and anxious" about the task at hand, as he prepares to head back to Merseyside, writes Mirror Football's Aaron Flanagan. 
"Liverpool are prepared to help me an awful lot. They want to help me to become a better coach or a better manager," Gerrard said to BBC Sport. 
"But at the same time I've got to commit to it and put in the hard work." Klopp: Everyone wanted Coutinho 
Jurgen Klopp has revealed that "everybody wanted" Liverpool forward Philippe Coutinho. 
The Brazilian signed a new five-year deal at Anfield earlier this week despite interest from elsewhere, writes the Liverpool Echo's Andy Kelly. 
Coutinho's contract extension announcement was the only high point of a disappointing day for Liverpool on Wednesday as they crashed out of the EFL Cup at the semi-final stage. 
Speaking after the Saints' 2-0 aggregate victory – adding a 1-0 Anfield victory to their 1-0 victory at St Mary's – Klopp said: “Two sides made a big statement – the club and Phil. 
“The player, everybody in the world to have him in their team, that he wants to stay here is for us unbelievably important." Read More
